security: Using an apartment that is "too well known" as a safehouse could compromise the operation and endanger AMMUG-1. Directly quoting: "this address is too well known."
summary: This memorandum outlines the decision to use a specific apartment as a safehouse for AMMUG-1, despite concerns about the address being too well-known.
summary_one_paragraph: On May 14, 1964, a memorandum records the verbal agreement with Mr. (Ray Scofield) to utilize apartment #731-West at HUNTING TOWERS, MT. VERNON BLVD., ALEXANDRIA, as a safehouse for AMMUG-1. The apartment, viewed by C/WH/SA/CI, was considered adequate. Libby (WH/SA/CI) and Mr. (Scofield) will inventory the household equipment around May 19, 1964, with plans to move AMMUG-1 in shortly after WED staffers finish debriefing. Mr. (Scofield) will notify Mr. (John Ryan) of the Safehouse Branch to cease searching for other apartments in the N.W. section of Washington.
title: Safehouse for AMMUG-1
